I think there has never been a better time to thrive as a creator than now


Monetization, Brand deals. InfoFi campaigns. Creator programs.


A few years ago, this was available only to top-tier creators.


AI has dramatically reduced the barrier to entry.


However, that accessibility comes with a tradeoff.


When everyone can create, standing out becomes the true skill.


AI can produce volume, but it cannot produce perspective.


I think that‚Äôs where opportunity lives.


Even doing the bare minimum today means you can easily stand out from the crowd by adding your perspective.


Also, brands are no longer looking for people who can just generate copy.


They‚Äôre looking for creators who can tell stories that connect with real audiences.


AI levels the playing field, but it also raises the standard.


Creators who bring insight, taste, and originality will always outperform those relying on prompts alone.


While writing about your favorite protocols, share your experiences, your interaction with UI, give genuine feedback, tell your story about using the product in your way.


By doing this alone, you can easily outperform many people today.

$ETH  Compresses Within Key EMA Range as Momentum Fades   Summary  Ethereum is currently experiencing extreme price compression on the daily timeframe, oscillating within a narrow corridor between the EMA9 and EMA50. While the short-term 4-hour momentum shows a technical bullish cross, the broader macro structure remains bearish with a sequence of lower highs. The high intraday volatility and lack of volume support suggest a market in search of a decisive catalyst rather than a sustained reversal.   Details  1. Daily Chart Price Action: Closed as a small bullish candle on declining volume, holding above the EMA9. Moving Averages: Price is wedged in a tight squeeze between the EMA9 (immediate support) and EMA50. Momentum (MACD): MACD lines are converging above the zero line; bullish histograms are consistently diminishing. Macro Context: Weekly timeframe remains bearish, capped by the EMA9. However, EMAs are beginning to cluster, and shrinking bearish histograms suggest a potential long-term trend shift or consolidation phase.   2. 4-Hour Chart Price Action: A rally to $3147 was met with a swift rejection, currently stabilizing near the EMA50. Moving Averages: Bullish alignment is challenged as price retreats below short-term averages. Momentum (MACD): A bullish crossover has formed below the zero line with expanding green histograms. Volume: Bearish volume on the recent rejection significantly outweighed the prior bullish volume.   3. 1-Hour Chart Price Action: Sharp reversal from $3147 back to the $3100 handle. Multiple long wicks indicate high sell-side pressure at local peaks. Moving Averages: The EMA9 briefly crossed above the EMA200 before reversing downward. All averages are now converging with a downward bias. Momentum (MACD): A bearish crossover has formed above the zero line with expanding red histograms. Volatility: Increased volume during the sell-off highlights elevated intraday volatility.

UK lawmakers are calling for a complete ban on political donations made with crypto, citing risks of foreign interference and transparency concerns.

Their recommendations target all digital assets, not just Bitcoin or Ethereum.

Who‚Äôs affected? 
2/ The committee‚Äôs report highlights the challenge of tracing crypto donors, making it tough to confirm identities or funding sources.

It points to the growth of digital assets, warning current rules leave parties open to abuse.

Tighter controls are under review.
3/ A potential ban on crypto donations could reshape party fundraising strategies.

Political groups may need to reassess risk management and compliance as new rules try to address anonymity, traceability, and safeguarding electoral integrity.
4/ Lawmakers argue that crypto‚Äôs unique features could undermine transparency in political financing.

As debates intensify, any policy shift will test how parties adapt to the evolving landscape of digital regulation and political accountability.

VITALIK BUTERIN PUSHES FOR REAL TRANSPARENCY AT X

Elon Musk just announced that ùïè will open-source its recommendation algorithm within 7 days, with updates every 4 weeks.

Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin is cautiously supportive -- but says open code isn‚Äôt enough: users need ways to verify what actually happens to their content and why they‚Äôre shown or suppressed.

Buterin and others are even proposing cryptographic proofs and blockchain-based audit systems so algorithmic decisions can be checked without exposing private data.

The debate boils down to this:

CRYPTO CONTENT ENGAGEMENT FALLS SHARPLY ON X AND YOUTUBE

- Crypto-related content on X and YouTube is seeing its weakest engagement levels in years.

- Data and commentary from platform executives, analysts, and creators suggest the downturn is structural rather than temporary.

X: Visibility Declines Across Crypto Accounts

- Crypto posts on X are reaching fewer users, even from established accounts. According to X‚Äôs head of product Nikita Bier, the drop is not caused by an algorithm change.

- Bier said users exhaust their own visibility by posting or replying too frequently, often with low-value messages. Once an account hits its daily exposure limit, later posts receive minimal distribution.

- X users typically see only 20‚Äì30 posts per day. When those slots are filled with repetitive replies or engagement farming, substantive updates fail to surface.

Disagreement Over Responsibility

- Bier described Crypto Twitter‚Äôs decline as ‚Äúself-inflicted,‚Äù arguing that excessive posting reduces reach for meaningful content.

- Many users pushed back, saying the explanation ignores systemic suppression and treats symptoms rather than causes. 

- Crypto remains one of X‚Äôs largest content categories, yet engagement continues to fall.

Spam and Automation Add Pressure

- CryptoQuant founder Ki Young Ju argues that the situation cannot be explained by user behavior alone.

- Ju pointed to a surge in automated crypto-related posts, with more than 7.7 million posts generated in a single day. That represents an increase of over 1,200% from previous levels.

- According to Ju, this flood of low-quality content appears to have triggered broad visibility restrictions that affect legitimate accounts alongside bots.

- He criticized X for applying category-level suppression instead of improving bot detection.

Paid Verification Fails as a Filter

- Ju also questioned X‚Äôs paid verification model, saying it has failed to distinguish real users from automated accounts.

- Bots can now pay for verification and continue posting at scale, while genuine users experience reduced reach. 

- As a result, verification no longer signals credibility or quality.

YouTube Shows Similar Declines

- Crypto-related YouTube views have dropped to their lowest levels since early 2021. 

- Data shared by ITC Crypto founder Benjamin Cowen showed a steady decline in average views across major channels over the past three months.

- Several creators noted that engagement never recovered after the last market cycle.

Retail Interest Remains Weak

- Creators across YouTube, TikTok, and X report similar trends.

- Retail audiences appear fatigued after years of scams, failed projects, and speculative cycles. Some creators attribute the decline to repeated pump-and-dump schemes that pushed viewers away.

- Others note that institutional participants now dominate market activity, reducing the role of retail-driven narratives.

- Some analysts argue that audiences have moved toward macro assets and traditional markets.

- Returns, rather than long-term crypto narratives, are driving attention. In recent periods, commodities and metals outperformed Bitcoin, reinforcing the shift.

Sentiment Shows Early Stabilization

- Despite lower engagement, on-chain analytics firms report improving sentiment around Bitcoin.

- Sentiment around Ethereum remains mixed, with no clear trend. Analysts say key price levels will determine whether retail confidence returns.
